title: Firefox: Server not Found
content:
Hello,

I have a website, https://zoroto.vip/, and I mostly use Firefox for browsing. Today, while randomly checking my site and reloading it as I usually do to ensure everything is working fine, I encountered a serious issue.

The site stopped loading on Firefox, and I got an error message something like "Server not found" or "Site not working." My first thought was that there might be a hosting issue, so I contacted my hosting provider, but they confirmed that everything is fine on their end.

To further investigate, I opened my site on Google Chrome and other browsers, and it loaded perfectly fine without any issues. This problem seems to be only happening in Firefox.

I have already gone through the following Mozilla support guide: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-cant-load-websites-other-browsers-can

I followed the steps mentioned there, but unfortunately, none of them solved my issue. I also tried clearing the cache, disabling add-ons, and even testing in a private window, but the problem persists.

I have attached a screenshot of the error message I am getting. Please check and let me know if anyone has faced this issue before or if there's a possible fix for it.
creator: juanw

title: Location Services Not Working Properly in Firefox?
content:
I’ve been having trouble with Firefox’s location services when trying to find nearby stores and restaurants. Even with location settings enabled, some websites fail to detect my accurate location, or they display outdated information.

For example, when I try to use Wendy’s Near Me Wendy’s Near Me to find the closest Wendy’s location, the site sometimes fails to pinpoint my exact area, while other browsers seem to work fine.

Has anyone else experienced this issue? Are there any specific Firefox settings or extensions that can improve location accuracy? Any troubleshooting tips would be appreciated!
creator: wndysmenu

title: Firefox Not Displaying Embedded Social Media Insights Correctly?
content:
I’ve been using Firefox to research social media strategies, but I’ve noticed that some websites displaying engagement insights and analytics don’t load properly. Charts, embedded data, and interactive elements either take too long to load or don’t appear at all.

For example, when checking Best Times to Post on TikTok to optimize my posting schedule, some graphs and engagement heatmaps don’t display correctly in Firefox, while they work fine in other browsers.

Has anyone else experienced issues with Firefox not rendering social media analytics tools properly? Are there any specific settings or extensions that could improve this?

title: Saved passwords after signing out on Firefox (SECURITY HOLE?)
content:
Recently, i had to use a public pc in my workplace for a while. i used Firefox to access the internet, and for practical reason, i signed in my Firefox account. After i was done, i made sure i have signed out my Firefox account before leaving. The next day, when i used Firefox again on that pc, i noticed that all my saved passwords (from syncing my Firefox account) were still in that Firefox browser, even though i haven't signed in my Firefox account. Now i feel like i am at the mercy of fate because anybody who used that pc after me yesterday could have gained access to all my passwords. So far, nothing bad happens and i hope it stays that way.

I don't know if anyone has brought this up. Since Firefox does not erase any saved password after a user signs out, I think Firefox should, or rather, MUST give a warning message after a user signs out of Firefox to manually erase any saved password on Firefox, so that any stupid user like me will not make that stupid mistake so easily.

title: Para esa basura obligan actualizar de V104.0.1
content:
Llevaba años usando la versión 104.0.1 de Firefox para Windows sin ningún problema.

Ahora, obligan a actualizar con ese molesto mensaje de 'versión obsoleta' y después desactivan todos los complementos, forzando actualizar.

Actualicé a la versión 131.0 y solo hay problemas: Picos de uso intenso de CPU, aumentando la temperatura y, como consecuencia, el ruido constante de los ventiladores. Es un escándalo usar Firefox ahora.

Siempre a peor con sus nefastas actualizaciones.
